input: Type: Poem, Theme: A lover's parting, Style: Shakespearean
output:
Farewell fair lady, my dearest,
Parting doth grieve my heart.
Thou art the love of mine eyes, my sweet treasure,
As spring's first rosebud doth delight.

But fate doth will it so,
That thou must journey on thy way.
I'll bid thee adieu with a kiss upon thy cheek,
And hope that we may meet again someday.

May our paths cross once more,
Though time and distance intervene.
Until then, fare thee well,
With love always on thy side.
